summary: This document contains two reminder emails from the FBI Victim Services Division regarding a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein scheduled for October 15, 2019, in Miramar, Florida. The emails provide logistical details, security protocols, and instructions for expense reimbursement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI briefing; the perpetrator whose victims are the intended attendees of the meeting.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Division Briefing for Epstein Victims
events.description: A meeting organized by the FBI Victim Services Division for victims of Jeffrey Epstein, held in Miramar, Florida, with strict security protocols regarding identification and electronic devices.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division organized a formal briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein on October 15, 2019.
The meeting had strict security protocols, prohibiting electronic devices like cell phones and recording equipment in FBI space.
The FBI offered to reimburse victims for certain travel expenses (lodging, mileage, tolls) but not for food or incidental hotel charges.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing federal process to engage with and provide services to Epstein's victims after his death.
The document reveals the FBI's operational address for victim correspondence as 935 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC.
